auction_name: Alberta Ferretti for Emilia Romagna
item_title: ALBERTA FERRETTI | CHIARA
description:
Pink silk duchesse gown with a fitted bodice wide pleated double layered skirt with a superlative long train.

The Waistline is accented by a black-colored velvet ribbon.

The creation of this gown required 25 meters of fabric.


This dress was chosen by Chiara Ferragni in 2018 for the Cannes Film Festival red carpet.

Size 40


Abito in duchesse di seta color rosa con corpino aderente ampia gonna ed un magnifico lungo strascico tutto doppiato con lo stesso tessuto.

Punto vita sottolineato da un nastro in velluto di colore nero.

La realizzazione di questo abito ha richiesto l'utilizzo di 25 metri di tessuto.


L'abito e stato scelto da Chiara Ferragni nel 2018 per il red carpet del Festival di Cannes.

Taglia 40

auction_name: Alberta Ferretti for Emilia Romagna
item_title: ALBERTA FERRETTI | AMANDA
description:
Olive green silk satin gown embellished with contrasting champagne-colored chantilly lace decorating the bodice and straps. The back is finished with a satin bow closure at the back neckline.


Actress Amanda Seyfried wore this dress for a Shanghai event in 2016.

Size 40


Abito in satin di seta verde oliva impreziosito da pizzo chantilly a contrasto color champagne che decora corpetto e spalle.

La scollatura e realizzata con un fiocco in satin che cade sulla schiena.


L'attrice Amanda Seyfried ha scelto questo abito ad un evento a Shanghai nel 2016.

Taglia 40

auction_name: Alberta Ferretti for Emilia Romagna

embroidery at the waist. Silk satin slip dress underneath.


This dress was chosen by Angelina Jolie in 2005 to attend the annual Worldwide Orphans Foundation gala in New York honoring Christine Ebersole .

Size 40


Abito di tulle color champagne decorato con ricamo in perline ed elementi di metallo e gonna a spicchi con nastri di tulle a taglio vivo.

La vita sottolineata da una cintura in gros grain a contrasto con coccarda ricamata mentre sulla schiena presenta una profonda scollatura. Sottoveste in satin di seta.


L'abito e stato scelto da Angelina Jolie nel 2005 per la Sua partecipazione al gala annuale della Worldwide Orphans Foundation a New York in onore di Christine Ebersole.

auction_name: An Haut Bohemian: Andrew Allfree
item_title: Howard Hodgkin (1932-2017) Eye
exhibited:
London, Alan Cristea Gallery, Signature Pieces: Contemporary British Prints & Multiples, 1st January - 31st December 1999 (another example)

London, Alan Cristea Gallery, Howard Hodgkin: Volume II, Into the Woods, 7 June - 30 June 2001 (another example)


--------------------------------------------------------------


Londres, Alan Cristea Gallery, Signature Pieces: Contemporary British Prints & Multiples, 1er Janvier - 31 decembre 1999 (autre exemplaire)

Londres, Alan Cristea Gallery, Howard Hodgkin: Volume II, Into the Woods, 7 juin - 30 juin 2001 (autre exemplaire)
provenance: A gift from the artist to the present owner.
literature:
Liesbeth Heenk, Howard Hodgkin: The Complete Prints - A Catalogue Raisonne, London, 2003, no. 102, illustrated


---------------------------------------------------------------------


Liesbeth Heenk, Howard Hodgkin: The Complete Prints - A Catalogue Raisonne, Londres, 2003, no. 102, illustre
description:
Howard Hodgkin (1932-2017)

 

Eye


signed with the artist's initials dated 2000 and numbered AP 18/18


etching and aquatint on handmade paper


28 x 325 cm ; 11 x 12 13/16 in.


Executed in 2000 this work is the artist's proof 18 from 18 from an edition of 40 in Arabic numerals + 18 artist's proofs and 5 printer's proofs.


The work was printed at the 107 Workshop Wiltshire and co-published by The Institute of Contemporary Art Philadelphia and Alan Cristea Gallery London. 

 

 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Howard Hodgkin (1932-2017)

 

Eye


signe des initiales de l'artiste date 2000 et numerote AP 18/18


eau-forte et aquatinte sur papier artisanal


28 x 325 cm ; 11 x 12 13/16 in.

Executee en 2000 cette oeuvre est l'epreuve d'artiste no. 18 sur18 d'une edition de 40 en chiffres arabaes + 18 epreuves d'artistes et 5 epreuves d'imprimeur.


L'oeuvre a ete imprimee a l'atelier 107 Wiltshire et coeditee par The Institute of Contemporary Art Philadelphie et Alan Cristea Gallery Londres.

item_title: A glazed earthenware table service by Ceramica Principessa Borghese Pratica di Mare 1997 | Service de table en ceramique sous glacure Ceramica Principessa Borghese Pratica di Mare 1997
description:
A glazed earthenware table service by Ceramica Principessa Borghese Pratica di Mare 1997


commissioned by Andrew Allfree for twelve


turquoise with a gilded border marked on reverse with stylised eagle with a "P" and "AA" with arrow comprising: twelve dinner plates twelve soup plates twelve dessert plates two circular dishes two oval vegetable dishes a large circular dish two covered bowls two sauce boats twelve fingers bowls a coffee pot a milk pot twelve coffee cups and saucers and six candlesticks


Diam. dinner plate 10 5/8 in


(91)


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Service de table en ceramique sous glacure Ceramica Principessa Borghese Pratica di Mare 1997


commande par Andrew Allfree pour douze personnes


modele turquoise avec bordure doree les revers marques << P >> suivi avec un aigle stylise et << AA >> avec une fleche comprenant: douze assiettes de table douze assiettes creuses douze assiettes a dessert deux plats ronds deux legumiers ovales un grand plat de service circulaire deux bols couverts deux saucieres douze rince doigts une cafetiere un cremier douze tasses a cafe douze sous-tasses et six flambeaux


Diam. de l'assiette de table. 27 cm


(91)

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: Buccellati |Sapphire tzavorite and kunzite Cocktail Ring
exhibited: Exhibited in New York and Seoul.
provenance: Donated directly by Buccellati.
literature: Buccellati introduced the new Macri Color collection, a natural evolution of a design of unparalleled beauty and synonymous with Italian quality and excellence. Characterized by stones with a mysterious charm and bright colors, this collection represents the perfect combination of technique and aesthetics. The sinuosity of the shapes - given by the softness of the "rigato" and "ornato" engravings - and the vividness of the stones combine with elegance, making the Buccellati style perfectly recognizable. In addition, the contrast given using gold in different colors further accentuates the scenic and highly chromatic effect of these creations.
description:
Of bombe design entirely engraved and set at the center with an oval shaped kunzite further enhanced with tzavorites and sapphires signed Buccellati ring size 53.

provenance: Donated directly by Dolce&Gabbana.
literature: These splendid earrings, in the form of a violin, are distinguished by the richness of the workmanship entirely executed by hand, and the preciousness of the gemstones. The body of the instrument, the fingerboard, scroll, tuning pegs and bow are described in minute detail. The all-around modelling of the surfaces, engraved with the milleraies technique by master Italian artisans, is further accentuated by the pave of diamonds covering the chin rest and by the rubies that adorn the fingerbo ard. The composition is also embellished at the lobe by two pink spinels surrounded by round-shaped diamonds that make these earrings a true masterpiece of Alta Gioielleria.
description:
Each designed as a violin enhanced with rubies and suspended to an oval shaped spinel framed by brilliant-cut diamonds

signed Dolce&Gabbana Alta Gioielleria.

literature: Original designs copyrighted by Elsa Peretti. Newly crafted jewelry.
description:
Each "Bone" cuff designed by Elsa Peretti(r) for Tiffany & Co reminds us of a jewelry revolution in 1970's.

First created in silver this jewel has marked the victory of design over stones Elsa Peretti iconic designer

was used to say "Style has to be simple" and one among the celebrities who embraced it was Liza Minnelli

photographed wearing a Bone Cuff in 1972 the year she won the Academy Award for Best Actress for Cabaret. The custom piece also features a hand-engraved treble clef and an inset diamond.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: L'inevitabilita
provenance: Donated directly by Contini Art Gallery and artist Enzo Fiore.
literature: The generative force of nature emerges in Enzo Fiore's work through a unique and indissoluble interweaving of moss, roots, twigs, leaves, earth, stones and insects, encompassing an elegant composition on a black background, where nature triumphs in all its magnificence. Biological elements such as branches, roots and leaves, ground, moss and insects are elevated as sacred apparatus in the artist's method. The astonishing power of Enzo Fiore's innovative language manifests itself through "transience", intended as vanitas, without which everything would have no origin; however, he does not only focus on transience, but he savors the taste of the imaginative, giving new life to what seems to have ended its journey. In front of this artwork, the gaze penetrates the innermost processes of human nature, which sinks into the contemplation of nature and genius. The elements of the animal and plant world that are married within a thick layer of resin and appear as a further reflection and symbol of the transience of existence, that is between death and rebirth there is a perpetual cycle of mysterious regeneration and metamorphosis. One could almost speak of an encyclopedic vocation that leads the artist that traces and captures the circle of life in a single gaze. This composition is in fact a true representation of a moment, sealed in the resin in order to unleash that single and unique pulse of infinite life.
description:
Enzo Fiore

b.1968

L'inevitabilita


Executed in 2023.

Signed and dated 2023

Earth roots butterfly on wood and aluminum

23 3/5 x 11 4/5 in. (60 x 30 cm.)

item_title: JACOB & CO.| Mother of pearl sapphire and diamond  "One Row Rainbow"
provenance: Donated directly by Jacob & Co.
literature:
Limited Edition: Individually Numbered Pieces

Brand new. Warranty: 2 Years


It is Jacob & Co.'s privilege to present the Andrea Bocelli Foundation with this Brilliant One Row Rainbow. Andrea Bocelli is a trusted and close friend of Jacob & Co.'s, which share his calling to support and empower those who need it the most. It is in our nature to give back and this piece is our contribution to the generous work of his foundation. The Brilliant One Row Rainbow encapsulates our sense of femininity, elegance, and high jewelry. The rows of white diamonds, the mother-of-pearl dial, and the Rainbow Sapphires hour markers all shine their own seducing, shimmering lights.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: Carpet with Horses
provenance: Donated by the Bocelli Family.
literature: Two important names in a single exquisite work of art: the famous and late photographer Giovanni Gastel, the poet of the lens, he who overhauled the language of image in fashion, captured Andrea Bocelli, his wife Veronica Berti, and their respective steeds in a memorable sequence of shots in 2019. A detail that frames two wonderful horses from the Bocelli stables, Caudillo and Nevado, today becomes the subject of a work of art by Lorenzo Maleki, architect and scholar of ancient hand-knotting from the Persian tradition and the rest of the world. The tapestry evokes the highly refined craftsmanship that dates back a thousand years, once the exclusive preserve of royal and imperial families, drafting a fine piece that is utterly unique and conveys powerful beauty.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: American Incomplete Flag
provenance: Donated by Contini Art Gallery and artist Mario Arlati.
literature:
The iconic "Incomplete Flags" by Italian artist Mario Arlati recall feelings and images of the past, and reconnect thoughts before the viewer's eyes. His flags are meant to evoke ideas, memories and passions of individuals and communities in constant confrontation and change. They can be made up of worn and disconnected remnants of cloth or alternatively in firm and glossy ceramic. Ceramic, so full of soul and feeling, becomes a code, a key to interpretation, a secret word to gain access to the visual process, to unveil it. The ceramic flags become an evolution of the earliest concept of the "virtuous recycling" of salvaged materials, due to Arlatis' consideration of matter as an inner reflection made up of feelings and evocations.


These artwork's colors overload themselves with experiences and reveal echoes of history, literature, music and poetry. Colour and its conception are understood as the symbolic decision, tearing and dramatic, on the action of time and memory which has become an interior experience and which has felt inside the coming to life of the color itself.


His flags represent pieces of pop inspiration which are full of social value, an homage to the painting of Jasper Johns and to the vision of Richard Rauschenberg.

Arlati emphasizes the term 'incomplete', highlighting the active role of the spectator - who becomes an emancipated spectator, according to the definition of Jacques Ranciere - where the spectator is being invited, to complete the work with his own eyes and intuition, behind the artist's input.


Mario Arlati's artworks are always influenced by the surrounding environment, particularly by its colors, its materials and light, reconnecting with the ideals of Arte Povera.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: Guitarra Manuel Rodriguez
provenance: Donated by the Bocelli Family.
literature:
Founded more than 100 years ago in Cadiz, MR Guitars has reached every corner of the world. It has traveled, grown and evolved. Its guitars are a sign of commitment to culture. Spirit and essence of Spanish music, they are elaborated with all the core and attention of their luthlers. They, the true stars of this house, have learned through a legacy that has passed from father to son, from master to apprentice: inheriting the tenacity and expertise of Manuel Rodriguez, son of the first luthier of a family name that has already made history.


It is in itself a trusted friend, an intimate solo voice or a supportive sound to singing, a companion to every inspiration, every joy, or tenderness.


But the Manuel Rodriguez guitar, a luthier's masterpiece born from a renowned artisanal art that for over a century has passed down the essence of Spanish musical culture, represents much more than a precious musical instrument.

In fact, it is the concrete expression of a virtuous cycle, a "cycle of goodness" that has passed from the hands of Antonio Banderas and Richard Gere - who documented their involvement by signing the guitar - to those of the Bocelli family. ABF (Andrea Bocelli Foundation) has supported the projects of Fundacion Starlite, and this true acoustic jewel seals our partnership.

Today, the same instrument, after sharing a year of life in the arms of Maestro Bocelli, will multiply its philanthropic utility and its story, passing from Andrea's hands to those who wish to support the projects of the Andrea Bocelli Foundation.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: Generazione
provenance: Donated by Contini Art Gallery and artist Park Eun Sun.
literature: Park's work, respecting the nature of the composition material, appears as a chain of polished and two-colored geometric shapes that seem to extend beyond, whirling on themselves like energetic and unstoppable spirals. His sculptures are characterized by a linear and structured abstraction, and then blossom into representations that refer to a vital imagination as if they were streams of DNA that turned into a metaphorical synthesis that embodies the continuous flow of life. The predilection for unusual harmonies and balances generates masterpieces that combine refinement and composure but also sinuosity and dynamism. Conceived in an alternation of pink and white marble, this sculpture extends upwards in a spiral that symbolizes a perpetual motion that seems to refuse to stop. The sculptures, also appear to be inspired by the concept of evolution, duplicating and unwinding into spherical volumes charged with an energy bent on transmutation. The harmony of colors and shapes is accentuated by unusual balances, apparently unstable and unreal but at the same time solid and firmly anchored, as if they were born from the earth, extending into space, involving human beings and their lives and dragging them with soft lightness towards the sky, precisely, into infinity. The intersecting forms, sinuous or soaring, the voids and solids that compose the structure of the work, the multiple and alternating colors, the game of shadow and light, the balance and instability, the composure and asymmetry, the rational and the infinite: all these aspects demonstrate how Park Eun Sun's art appears to be in a constant dualism that does not celebrate opposites, but rather merges them together, underlining how constantly evolving dichotomies characterize art, existence and humankind.

item_title: Andrea Bocelli
provenance: Ordered by Mr. Enrico Gallo and offered to the Andrea Bocelli Foundation for the charity auction. Made in Forte dei Marmi.
literature: One of the iconic portraits of Maestro Andrea Bocelli is immortalized thanks to the creative genius of Simon Berger, who transforms it into a work of art through an innovative technique achieved by micro-shattering glass plates. A "morphogenesis", as the Swiss artist who conceived it calls it, through which features are revealed by the fragments derived from the scratches: the closer the hammer blows are, the greater the contrasts and nuanced detailing. Today Simon Berger is one of the most highly regarded visual artists in the world, having devised from scratch such an expressive technique based on unusual transparent canvases that become the backdrop for astonishing glassy paintings.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: Brave Actions For a Better World (2)
provenance: Donated directly by OTB Foundation.
literature: Simone d'Auria presents his alter ego, Mr. Spoon, the spoon protagonist of his works that comes to life through them, becoming the vehicle for the message at the core of D'Auria's art: EAT YOUR LIFE and BRAVE ACTIONS FOR A BETTER WORLD, a hic et nunc in a modern key. The artist's spoon is a symbol, a scepter, a catalyst for attention capable of activating the critical sense of the observer. The spoon, the protagonist of the works, comes to life, becoming the vehicle for his message, not a hymn to lightness itself, but a strong awareness of time that must be fully experienced, without losing a single drop. The symbol of the spoon originates from Simone D'Auria's passion and studies on the Florentine Renaissance, during which the utensil was used almost exclusively by the great families of patrons. From this comes the idea of Mr. Spoon, a Renaissance character reinterpreted by the artist in both sculpture and painting, to urge the interlocutor to satisfy their appetite not only with food but by doing something grand without waiting for tomorrow, but doing it today.

auction_name: Andrea Bocelli Foundation Charity Auction | Hosted by Sothebys
item_title: Moby Sbang Gold - Unique Piece Edition 1/8
provenance: Acquired from private donor.
literature:
A slap to your Eco-Conscience is a sculpture that aims to provoke the viewer to reflect on their impact on the ecosystem, particularly addressing the endangered whales, the only remaining mammal species. Its form, almost like a fluid without expression, seeks to embrace hope in humanity, urging individuals to contemplate their mistakes and focus on constructive actions rather than destruction.


"My definition of art is to create everything that you believe in and that stirs up feelings inside of you. When I create a work, I'm not just doing something, I'm expressing what I believe in. All successful artists, from Picasso to Monet, are people like us. The only difference is that they feel a deep passion for what they are doing. They do what they love, and they love what they do, and this makes them idols in the eyes of the public. When you truly believe in something, you end up doing it. My carrier started with Architecture, it developed into Design and after it became Art, through which I have been able to fully express myself. My art stimulates the spectators' reaction and show them the possibility of achievement thanks to their own skills and abilities. Every work is different from the other, but they all express a positive energy and attitude towards life and nature, because it is through them that I am able to create my pieces of art, using pure materials such as stone, marble, steel and recycled plastic. I had the privilege of working for several famous brands, like: Lungarno Hotel Collection of Ferragamo, Piaggio, MV Agusta, Leica, Bally, Sportmax, Paola Frani, as well as exhibiting in some of the most important international museums and foundations (Triennale di Milano, Moma NYC and Onu NYC, Farnesina, Fondazione Mont Blanc, Rosini Gutman Foundation, Art Masters St. Moritz), Art Basel 2018 Basilea, Art Basel Miami 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, Art Karlsruhe Germany, Personal Exhibitions in Milano and Parma with Art&Co Gallery, Saint-Tropez Personal Exhibition 2022, MAG di Padova Personal Exhibition 2022/2023, Miami Personal Exhibition 2023 with Carousel Gallery, Museo Tamayo Mexico City 2023 and in 2022 the collaboration with Skira Editore for personal book edition "Simone D'Auria Follow Me"."

description:
Property from a prominent Japanese museum collection

Sam Francis

1923 - 1994

SF58-244 (Untitled)


signed Sam Francis and inscribed on the reverse

mixed media on paper

1615 x 122 cm; 63 5/8 x 48 1/8 in.

This work was executed at the end of the 1970s and the 1980s.


This work is identified with the interim identification number of SF58-244 in consideration for the forthcoming Sam Francis: Catalogue Raisonne of Unique Works on Paper. This information is subject to change as scholarship continues by the Sam Francis Foundation.

552 x 749 cm; 213/4 x 291/2 in.

Executed on July 2 1943.


The authenticity of this work has been confirmed by the Fondation Paul Delvaux.

______________________________________________________________________________


Provenant d'une Collection Particuliere Belge

Paul Delvaux

1897 - 1994

Le Maimagne


titre LE MAIMAGNE LACUISINE date 2-7-43 et signe P. DELVAUX (en bas a droite)

encre de Chine et aquarelle sur papier

552 x 749 cm; 213/4 x 291/2 in.

Execute le 2 juillet 1943.


La Fondation Paul Delvaux a confirme l'authenticite de cette oeuvre.

auction_name: Art Impressionniste et Moderne Day Auction
item_title: Etude pour Galatee
provenance:
Musee Rodin, Paris

Eric Sabers, New York (acquired from the above in March 1984)

Private collection, New York

Sale: Christie's New York, February 26, 1990, lot 22

Private collection, Japan (acquired at the above sale)

Sale: Mainichi Auction, Tokyo, July 15, 2017, lot 362

Acquired at the above sale by the present owner
literature: Antoinette Le Normand-Romain, Rodin et le bronze: Catalogue des oeuvres conservees au Musee Rodin, Paris, 2007, vol. II, no. S.797, illustration of another cast p. 392
description:
Auguste Rodin

1840 - 1917

Etude pour Galatee (version sans tete ni bras gauche ni jambe gauche)


signed A. Rodin and numbered Ndeg6 ; inscribed (c) by Musee Rodin 1981 and signed with the foundry mark E. Godard / Fondr.

bronze

28 x 181 x 73 cm; 11 x 71/8 x 27/8 in.

Conceived circa 1900 and cast in bronze in 1981.


This work will be included in the forthcoming Catalogue Critique de l'OEuvre Sculpte d'Auguste Rodin currently being prepared by the Comite Auguste Rodin at Galerie Brame et Lorenceau under the direction of Jerome Le Blay.

_____________________________________________________


Auguste Rodin

1840 - 1917

Etude pour Galatee (version sans tete ni bras gauche ni jambe gauche)


signe A. Rodin et numerote Ndeg6; inscrit (c) by Musee Rodin 1981 et porte la marque du fondeur E. Godard / Fondr.

bronze

28 x 181 x 73 cm; 11 x 71/8 x 27/8 in.

Concu vers 1900 cette epreuve en bronze a ete fondue en 1981.


Cette oeuvre sera incluse au Catalogue Critique de l'OEuvre Sculpte d'Auguste Rodin actuellement en preparation par le Comite Rodin avec la collaboration de la galerie Brame & Lorenceau sous la direction de Jerome Le Blay

Paris, Musee d'Art moderne, Pablo Gargallo, 1881-1934, 1980-81, no. 28, another cast mentioned in the catalogue np. (titled Bijou (petit masque))

Madrid, Palacio de Cristal, Gargallo, 1881-1981: exposicion del centenario, 1981, no. 52b, another cast illustrated in the catalogue p. 124

Valence, Centro Cultural Bancaixa, Escultores y orfebres, 1993-94, no. 138, another cast illustrated in the catalogue p. 184

Zaragoza, Musee Pablo Gargallo, Gargallo y los metales, 1994, another cast illustrated in the catalogue np.

Valencia, Institut d'Art Modern & Biarritz, Centre Le Bellevue, Salle Les Rhunes et Les Vagues, Pablo Gargallo, 2004, another cast illustrated in the catalogue np.
provenance: Private collection, France
literature: Pierrette Gargallo-Anguera, Pablo Gargallo, catalogue raisonne, Paris, 1998, no. B1a, another cast illustrated p. 229
description:
Property from a Private French Collection

Pablo Gargallo

1881 - 1934

Epingle de cravate


bears the French hallmark

silver

height: 85 cm; 33/8 in.

Conceived in 1914-15 and cast in silver in an unnumbered edition of circa 50.


We would like to thank Mr. Jean Anguera for his assistance in cataloguing this work.

__________________________________________________________________________


Provenant d'une Collection Particuliere Francaise

Pablo Gargallo

1881 - 1934

Epingle de cravate


grave du poincon d'orfevre et de la tete de Minerve

argent

hauteur: 85 cm; 33/8 in.

Concu en 1914-15 et fondu en argent dans une edition non-numerotee d'environ 50 exemplaires. 


Nous remercions Mr. Jean Anguera pour son aide apportee a la redaction de cette fiche.

description:
Property from a Private French Collection

Auguste Rodin

1840 - 1917

Assemblage de deux mains (Main Gauche ndeg02 & Main Droite ndeg30) or Esquisse pour la Cathedrale


signed A. Rodin numbered 10/12 and stamped with the foundry mark A. Rudier Fondeur Paris; signed A. Rodin (in the interior)

bronze

148 cm x 54 x 96 cm; 5 7/8 x 2 1/8 x 3 3/4 in.

Conceived circa 1900 this bronze version cast in 1945.


This work will be included in the forthcoming Catalogue Critique de l'oeuvre sculpte d'Auguste Rodin being currently prepared by Galerie Brame & Lorenceau under the direction of Jerome Le Blay under the archive number 2023-6785B. 


__________________________________________________________________________


Provenant d'une Collection Particuliere Francaise

Auguste Rodin

1840 - 1917

signe A. Rodin numerote 10/12 et porte la marque du fondeur A. Rudier Fondeur Paris; signe A. Rodin (a l'interieur)

bronze

148 cm x 54 x 96 cm; 5 7/8 x 2 1/8 x 3 3/4 in.

Concue vers 1900 cette version fondue en bronze en 1945.


Cette oeuvre sera incluse au Catalogue Critique de l'oeuvre sculpte d'Auguste Rodin actuellement en preparation par la Galerie Brame & Lorenceau sous la direction de Jerome Le Blay sous le numero d'archive 2023-6785B.

description:
Auguste Rodin

1840 - 1917

Main crispee droite agrandissement ou grand modele


signed A. Rodin stamped with the foundry mark Georges Rudier Fondeur Paris and inscribed (c) by musee Rodin 1962.; stamped A. Rodin (in the interior)

bronze

465 x 305 x 203 cm; 181/4 x 12 x 8 in.

Conceived before 1898 enlarged by Henri Lebosse in 1905 this bronze cast in 1962. 


This work will be included in the forthcoming Catalogue Critique de l'oeuvre sculpte d'Auguste Rodin being currently prepared by Galerie Brame & Lorenceau under the direction of Jerome Le Blay under the archive number 2023-6798B.

__________________________________________________________________________


Auguste Rodin

1840 - 1917

Main crispee droite agrandissement ou grand modele


signe A. Rodin porte la marque du fondeur Georges Rudier Fondeur Paris et inscrit (c) by musee Rodin 1962.; porte le cachet A. Rodin (a l'interieur)

bronze

465 x 305 x 203 cm; 181/4 x 12 x 8 in.

Concu avant 1898 agrandie par Henri Lebosse en 1905 cette epreuve fondue en bronze en 1962.


Cette oeuvre sera incluse au Catalogue Critique de l'oeuvre sculpte d'Auguste Rodin actuellement en preparation par la Galerie Brame & Lorenceau sous la direction de Jerome Le Blay sous le numero d'archive 2023-6798B.

description:
Property from the Former Collection of Jacqueline Roque-Picasso

Pablo Picasso

1881 - 1973

Portrait d'une jeune femme d'apres Lucas Cranach le Jeune. II (B. 859 BA. 1053)


The important linoleum cut printed in colours on Arches wove paper inscribed and dedicated Pour Werner Son amie Jacqueline in pencil by Jacqueline Roque-Picasso (verso)

image: 648 x 533 cm; 251/2 x 21 in.; sheet: 767 x 57 cm; 301/4 x 223/8 in. 

Executed in 1958 the present work cited in Baer is a rare trial proof printed in five colours before the numbered edition of 50 published by Galerie Louise Leiris Paris. 


Picasso Celebrating 50 Years

Importante linogravure imprimee en couleurs sur papier velin Arches inscrit et dedicace Pour Werner Son amie Jacqueline au crayon par Jacqueline Roque-Picasso (verso)

image: 648 x 533 cm; 251/2 x 21 in.; feuille: 767 x 57 cm; 301/4 x 223/8 in. 

Executee en 1958 cette oeuvre citee dans Baer est une rare epreuve d'essai imprimee en cinq couleurs avant l'edition numerotee de 50 exemplaires publiee par la Galerie Louise Leiris Paris.

signe man Ray et date 1933 (en bas a droite); titre La Decoration des corps rationnels (en bas a gauche)

huile et feuille d'or sur toile

385 x 553 cm; 151/8 x 213/4 in.

Peint en 1933.


Andrew Strauss et Timothy Baum du Comite d'expertiste Man Ray ont confirme l'authenticite de cette oeuvre et son inclusion dans le Catalogue des Peintures de Man Ray actuellement en preparation.

auction_name: Arts d'Asie
item_title: An extraordinary gilt-bronze figure of Hayagriva Densatil monastery Tibet 14th century | Shi Si Shi Ji  Cang Chuan Dan Sa Ti Si Liu Jin Tong Ma Tou Jin Gang Li Xiang
description:
Property from a European Private Collection

An extraordinary gilt-bronze figure of Hayagriva

Densatil monastery Tibet 14th century


the six-armed krodha-vighnantaka with wings at his back decorated with diminutive vajras on the left and garudas on the right a horse-head above each of his three faces wearing sumptuous gem-set jewellery serpent bracelets and a serpent as a necklace with its head entwined with its tail at his abdomen a tiger skin dhoti with paws tied at the front its tiger head resting on his right thigh and tail on the left the deity striding in alidhasana and trampling intertwined naga serpents on a lotus pedestal with an intact consecration plate in the middle of his back and a fragmentary tenon below to secure the statue in its designated position on a tashi gomang stupa


Himalayan Art Resources item no. 13864.


Height 33 cm 13 in. ; Length 23 cm 9 in.

__________________________________________________________________________


Collection particuliere europeenne 

Extraordinaire statue de Hayagriva en bronze dore monastere de Densatil Tibet XIVe siecle

Jean-Luc Estournel, , asianart.com,2020Nian
description:
Property from a European Private Collection

An exceptional gilt-copper alloy figure of Mahakala inlaid with semi-precious stones

Densatil monastery Tibet early 15th century


the fragmentary roundel depicting Mahakala cast in high relief the guardian deity with a jewel-encrusted crown and earrings a flayed human skin tied by its arms and legs around his neck a serpent necklace with its head entwined with its tail at the left shoulder a string of severed heads a tiger-skin dhoti with paws tied at the front a belt with jewelled swags and hangings holding a karttrka and kapala standing in the militant alidha posture trampling a supine figure on a lotus pedestal and surrounded by an entourage of deities all enclosed within a massive tendril of scrolling vine


Himalayan Art Resources item no. 13865.


53 x 48 x 10.5 cm 20 7/8 by 18 7/8 by 4 1/8 in.

__________________________________________________________________________

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An illuminated and illustrated album page verso with calligraphy signed by 'Imad al-Hasani Persia Safavid dated 1019 AH/1610-11 AD recto with portrait of a Sufi Shaykh probably 'Abd al-Qadir al-Jilani India Deccan Hyderabad late 18th century
provenance:
Ex-collection Prince Firouz (1894-1982) and Princess Safiyeh Firouz, thence by descent.

Etude Daussy-Ricqles, Paris, 1 July 1991, lot 234.
description:
text: surah al-fatiha (I) vv. 1-7


ink and gouache heightened with gold on paper verso with 6 lines to the page written in nasta'liq in black ink in clouds reserved against an illuminated ground signed and dated lower left text panel surmounted by a gold and polychrome illuminated headpiece within floral illuminated borders laid down within gold-speckled cream margins seal impression lower right; recto with portrait inscription in nasta'liq in lower margin 


text panel: 11.5 by 6.8cm.

painting: 23 by 13.4cm.

leaf: 47 by 31cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A Hajj map of Mecca and Medina commissioned for A'isha Gul bint al-Hajj al-Sayyid Hasan Riza India or the Hijaz dated 1329 AH/1911 AD
description:
Ink gouache and gold on paper the page divided into panels depicting the sites of Mecca and Medina inscribed with location names in naskh in black ink the panels within silver scroll borders


40.4 by 55.5cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A view of the Prophet's Mosque in Medina and the sandals of the Prophet signed 'Ali ibn al-Sa'id Egypt or Turkey Ottoman dated 1278 AH/1861-62 AD
description:
gouache heighted with gold on paper the view of Medina and the Prophet's sandals framed by gold and polychrome rococo-style floriate scrolls signed below within a cartouche border with Arabic verses on the Prophet's sandal in white naskh in gilt-wood frame


70.4 by 61.4cm. framed

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: Five illuminated leaves from a large Qur'an in Bihari script India Sultanate 15th century
description:

item_title: An illuminated prayer book copied by Isma'il ibn Salih Turkey Ottoman dated 3 Jumada I 1192 AH/30 May 1778 AD
description:
Arabic manuscript on paper 255 leaves plus 4 fly-leaves 11 lines to the page written in naskh in black ink verses separated by gold roundels with blue and red dots headings in white on gold and polychrome illuminated panels the opening bifolio with gold and polychrome illuminated headpiece surmounting text in clouds in reserve against a gold ground a further bifolio similarly illuminated 3 full-page illustrations of Mecca Medina and the tombs of The Prophet Abu Bakr and 'Umar 9 illuminated hilyehs and 25 gold illuminated diagrams colophon signed and dated two further folios bearing dates 1184 and 1194 AH in gilt-stamped binding with flap green silk doublures


text panel: 14.9 by 7.7cm.

leaf: 19.4 by 10.5cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: Bizhan slays Nastihan and stems the Turanian night raid illustrated folio (f.328r.) from the Shahnameh of Shah Tahmasp attributed to Bashdan Qara Persia Tabriz Royal Atelier circa 1525-35
exhibited: Exposition d'art Islamique, Musee des Arts Decoratifs, Paris, 1903.
provenance:
Commissioned by the Safavid Emperor Shah Isma'il, circa 1522.
Completed under the patronage of his son Shah Tahmasp at the royal atelier,
Tabriz, circa 1525-40.
Presented in 1568 by Shah Tahmasp to the Ottoman Sultan Selim II (r.1566-74).
In the collection of Baron Edmund de Rothschild, Paris, 1903-34.
By Descent to Baron Maurice de Rothschild, Paris, 1934-57.
His estate 1957-59.
Arthur A. Houghton Jr., USA, 1959-88.
Christie's London, 11 October 1988, lot 12.
Private collection, Europe.
literature:
S.C. Welch, A King's Book of Kings, The Shah-nameh of Shah Tahmasp, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, 1972, p.194.
M.B. Dickson & S.C. Welch, The Houghton Shahnameh, Cambridge, Mass., and London, Harvard University Press, 1981, vol.II, pl.174.
S.R. Canby, The Shahnama of Shah Tahmasp, Yale University Press, New Haven and London, 2011, pp.194 (illus.) and 285.
S.R. Canby, The Shahnama of Shah Tahmasp: The Persian Book of Kings, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, 2014, p.236.
The Shahnameh of Shah Tahmasp, Tehran Museum of Contemporary Arts, Tehran, 2021.
description:

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A parcel-gilt huqqa base India Lucknow circa 1800
provenance: Oppi Untracht.
literature: O. Untracht & M. and A. Parpola, Metal Marvels, Stockholm, 1994, p.22, no.10.
description:
of bell-shaped form with truncated tubular neck chiselled chased and gilded the body decorated with a register of ogival medallions enclosing flowering poppy plants scrolling poppy bands below and to the shoulder neck with minor ogival poppy filled medallions


19.8cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A gold-mounted dagger (kris) and scabbard Malaysia 19th century
description:
the wavy steel blade with distinct pattern-welded pamor the chased gold hilt in 'jawa demam' form above a filigree gold cup (mendak) the gold repousse scabbard (wranka) with scrolling flowers the reverse engraved with floral motifs tip of sheath (buntut) decorated with fine filigree and granular work central diamond on underside


42.3cm. 

45.3cm. with scabbard

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A large carved jade bowl India Mughal 18th century
description:
the green nephrite jade carved as a polylobed deep bowl with a poppy flowerhead base two poppy leaves emanating from either-side with bud terminals


7cm. height

21.9cm. max. width

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A 'Longquan' celadon censer with Islamic inscriptions China probably Ming Dynasty 15th century
description:
the low cylindrical body with three wide central cartouches with Arabic inscriptions each between two narrow bands of detached floral spray cartouches the vessel covered with a thick glaze of olive-green except for the cartouches of inscriptions and a carved circular area on the underside both revealing the fine grey body burnt orange upon three sturdy triangular legs


12.6 cm. diam.; 12.4 cm. height

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A large Canton bowl and dishes made for Nasir al-Din Shah Qajar Persia dated 1294 AH/1877 AD
description:
the service consisting of one deep bowl two shallow dishes and eight matching plates decorated in the famille Rose Canton style with insects birds flowers and butterflies all bearing a nasta'liq inscription within a cartouche surmounted with two heraldic lions and suns under the Qajar crown the bowl dated with wooden stand


bowl: 37cm. diam.; 15.5cm. height

one shallow dish: 26.5cm. diam.; the other 23.7cm. diam.

plates: 25cm. diam. approx.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A blue and white porcelain ewer China Qing Dynasty late 17th/early 18th century with later gilt-copper mounts
description:
of pyriform shape supported by a circular splayed foot bulbous neck and serpentine spout and handle the gilt-copper handle and openwork hinged dome cover added later to the body and neck and welded together the porcelain body decorated in underglaze cobalt blue reserved on white with two large floral ogival medallions flanked with scrolling tendrils the neck and underbelly decorated with registers of geometrical patterns the spout with cloud-like motifs the underside of the lid marked with Chinese Export pseudo English hallmarks with incuse maker's mark IR


36.5cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A rare Iznik 'Golden Horn' pottery vase Turkey circa 1530-40
provenance: Private collection, USA, acquired by the owner's great-grandfather in Istanbul in the late 19th century
description:
with inverted pear-shaped body leading to a short inverted rim on a short slightly flared foot decorated in underglaze in cobalt-blue with intricate scrolls comprising six large spiral stems divided by six cobalt-blue and turquoise flowerheads interspersed with arabesques a frieze of half flowerheads and a turquoise band with repeated S-shaped scrolls above and below


14.3cm. height

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Iznik polychrome pottery tankard Turkey circa 1590
provenance:
Ex-private collection, Sweden, 1970s.
Acquired by the present owner in the early 1990s.
description:
of cylindrical form with a square handle painted in cobalt blue viridian green relief red and outlined in black decorated with saz leaves alternating with rosette sprays and tulips emanating from leafy crops bordered by half blossom bands


22cm. height

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Iznik polychrome pottery dish Turkey second half 16th century
provenance: Bonhams, London, 24 April 1997, lot 321.
description:
of shallow rounded form decorated in underglaze dark green cobalt-blue and bold red with black outlines decorated with tulips carnations and stylised flower heads the rim with wave and scroll border paired tulips and rosettes to underside one drill hole to foot


28.6cm. diam.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Iznik polychrome pottery tile Turkey circa 1575
provenance:
Ex-private collection, Sweden, 1970s.
Acquired by the present owner in the early 1990s.
description:
of rectangular form painted cobalt blue turquoise viridian green relief red and outlined in black the upper register decorated with scrolling cloud-bands entwined with foliate vines issuing rosettes and lotus palmettes the lower register with an arcade of major and minor palmettes


24.4 by 16.4cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An exceptional Ottoman dagger with gold-inlaid blade 16th century with silver gilt and niello hilt Turkey 17th century
description:
the curved robust wootz blade with three pronounced ribs the outer two running down the full length of the blade and the central mid-rib splitting towards the tip dividing the face of each side of the blade into three enclosed panels each panel decorated with intricate gold inlay the upper two incorporating Persian inscriptions in a fine nasta'liq script within lobed cartouches and a running chinoiserie split-leaf design intertwined with floral motifs and cloudbands; the lower panel with interlaced arabesques and floral work tapering towards the tip of the blade gilded silver hilt of waisted form with raised floral devices in high relief set onto a fully chased background with floral and leafwork design the details inlaid with niello work


39.5cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Ottoman embroidered regimental standard Turkey early 20th century
description:
of square shape with a coiled gold thread fringe the central panel embroidered with the tughra of Ottoman Sultan Mehmet V (r.1909-18) surrounded by four regimental flags some pikes double-headed axes and trumpets over a scroll of leaves from which are suspended five medals


124.2 by 139.6cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Ottoman dagger with wooden hilt and nielloed scabbard Turkey 17th century
description:
the double-edged blade with two fullers in centre and silver inlaid floral motif the walnut waisted hilt with iron mounts and studs scabbard decorated in repousse and niello with floral vines on one side the other side incised and nielloed with floral medallions the scabbard originally gilt silver the gilding now lacking 


35cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A Nasrid-revival dagger signed by V. Arana Spain Eibar 1885
description:
the straight double-edged fullered blade decorated at the forte with fleshy scrolls reserved on a punched ground the hilt and scabbard chiseled and chased with openwork cartouches of arabesque scrolls and confronting griffins encased by palmette plaques and borders engraved and damascened with scrolls the faceted bi-furcated pommel and upturned quillons with further damascened and chiselled decoration on a gold punched ground scabbard and pommel with palmette and bud terminals 


38.2cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Ottoman cuerda-seca tile Turkey first half 16th century
description:
on cobalt blue background decorated in turquoise light and bright green white turquoise manganese and yellow glazes with black outlines with a symmetrical design based on a central flowerhead and four radiating palmettes connected by geometrical arabesques terminating in saz leaves


25.5 by 26cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A rare Ottoman cuerda seca pottery tile Turkey first half 16th century
provenance: Ex-private collection, Greece.
description:
decorated in blue turquoise green white and yellow with black outlines with a symmetrical design based on a central flowerhead from which radiate split-palmettes with lotuses at the centre in wood frame


25.6 by 26cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A rare Diyarbakir polychrome pottery tile Turkey second half 16th century
description:
decorated in underglaze cobalt blue coral red turquoise and green on white background with dark green outlines with symmetrically arranged tulips saz leaves rosettes and prunus blossoms stemming from a miniature vase framed by a turquoise ogival shaped medallion further saz leaves and spring blossoms at the corners


32.5 by 35cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Ottoman gilt-copper (tombak) lidded ewer with associated basin and filter Turkey 18th century
description:
the ewer of truncated pyriform body with tall waisted neck applied swan-necked spout and handle hinged domical lid topped by stylised pinecone hammered engraved and punched floral garland decoration together with a large basin and detachable openwork filter


ewer: 33.4cm. height

basin: 35.3cm. diameter

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Ottoman voided silk velvet and metal-thread fragment Turkey probably Bursa first half 17th century
description:
the voided crimson silk velvet ground woven with offset rows of large carnation palmettes enclosing smaller tulips and carnations within a lattice of green stylised vine old collection label to reverse of lower right corner 'PA. Museum Persian Ex. No. 535 Date 10-28-26' lower left corner with card label '7 L AR13742 g / AT 95'


37.9 by 64.4cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A fine Ottoman leather document case Istanbul Turkey dated 1723
description:
of rectangular form with a bracket-form flap mounted with fastening and an elaborate brass lock plate the leather embroidered throughout with metal thread in a symmetrical design of a formal arabesque of flowering vines the upper front embroidered with 'Constantinople/ 1723' the interior flap inlaid gold flowers and arabesques a Parisian bookbinder's label to the inside


31.5 by 41cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: An Ottoman coral and jade cigarette holder Turkey 16th/17th century
description:
of baluster form with six sections of coral and spinach jade divided by silver and inlaid with gold arabesques and diamond bands


14.2cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A square table clock with lapis panels epigraphed in Turkish signed Johannes Benner Germany Augsburg c.1650
description:
Steel iron gilded brass and copper each side of the body with a panel of lapis-lazuli inscribed with gilded Turkish inscriptions resting on four small splayed feet the movement signed 'Johannes Benner Aug.'


98 cm. height; 12.2 cm. width

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A Samson Iznik-style vase with animals France 19th century
description:
of pear-shaped form with flaring neck on short foot painted in underglaze blue green and red outlined in black decorated with dogs rabbits partridges a roebuck and an owl the neck with geometrical motifs Samson mark to underside of foot


22.1cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A Samson Iznik-style lidded container with animals France 19th century
description:
the cylindrical body painted in underglaze blue green and red outlined in black decorated with dogs rabbits partridges a roebuck and an owl a centaur and an owl the lid with ribbon motifs radiating from a finial Samson mark to underside of foot


20cm.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A large Cantagalli Iznik-style dish with fish-scale and cintamani Italy 19th century
provenance: Ex-collection Lady Kate Davson (born Kate Foster) (1938-2020).
description:
of shallow rounded form with everted flaring rim decorated in underglaze cobalt blue green and relief red with black outlines cavetto with saz leaves palmettes prunus blossoms and central cintamani motif on a dark and apple green fish-scale design rim with saz leaves interspersed by prunus blossoms and blue and green fish-scale designs concentric row of rosettes to the outer border reverse with interspersed flowerheads and pairs of tulips Cantagalli cockerel mark to the centre


40.3 cm. diam.

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A Samson Iznik-style vase decorated with fish-scale medallions France 19th century
provenance:
Ex-Rowan Collection.
Purchased directly from Samson, Edme et Cie's workshop, Rue Beranger, Paris.
literature: F. Slitine, Samson - Genie de l'Imitation, Paris, 1999, p.76.
description:
the globular body on short flaring foot rising to a stepped shoulder the waisted tubular neck with flaring mouth and central boss the white body decorated with red and blue fish-scale medallions interspersed with blue hearts outlined in black similar designs on the upper neck interlocking geometrical pattern under mouth and shoulder black meandering arabesques around the boss and lower body two red lines around the foot Samson mark to underside of foot


35.5cm.

item_title: 'The Pasha of Egypt' after the 'Caravane du Sultan a La Mecque' series by Joseph-Marie Vien (1716-1809)

oil on canvas framed


45 by 37.8cm.

item_title: A pair of Porcelain de Paris figures of a Sultan and a Sultana France 19th century

auction_name: Arts of the Islamic World and India including Fine Rugs and Carpets
item_title: A pair of gilt-bronze 'Turquerie' chenets France circa 1770-1830
description:
comprising figures of two men clad in elegant fur-trimmed robes and voluminous turbans one smoking a pipe (chibouk) the other holding two cups both seated on scroll-moulded rococo-style bases with foliage flowers and shells


each 25.5cm. height; 30cm. approx. length

auction_name: Asian Arts / 5000 Years
item_title: A 'Longquan' celadon dish Yuan - early Ming dynasty | Yuan Zhi Ming Chu  Long Quan Qing You Pan

description:
Property from the Personal Collection of Sam and Myrna Myers in France

A large collection of approximately 2280 Asian art auction catalogues from 1940's to 2020


comprising around 2280 copies of Sotheby's Christie's Bonhams and various French auctions among other auction houses' catalogues on Chinese and Asian art from 1940's to present including approximately 261 old Sotheby's London and New York catalogues with green covers from the 1940s onwards some with results lists inside approximately 39 old Sotheby's HK catalogues at the Furama hotel from 1973 onwards and approximately 289 old Christie's catalogues with light orange covers from the 1950s as well as some duplicates (group photos available on request).

(approx. 2280)

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Mary Magdalene adoring the Crown of Thorns illuminated initial from a choirbook [France early 16th century]
description:
Mary Magdalene Adoring the Cross and Crown of Thorns


illuminated initial cut from a manuscript Choirbook in Latin on vellum. [France (Paris?) 16th century (1st half)]


One cutting c.130x150mm the initial 'G' probably from the antiphon 'Gloria patri et filio' for the feast of Mary Magdalene (22 July) the reverse with text in very formal gothic script and music in square notation on four-line red staves comprising part of the feast of St Anne (26 July) ('[sollemnita]te gaudent / [ange]li et col[laudant]') the face of one angel smudged and with a little surface wear but the pigments and burnished gold still bright.


PROVENANCE


This cutting has been offered by Sotheby's three times in the past 35 years: 5 December 1989 lot 47; 10 December 1996 lot 26; and 7 December 1999 lot 10a (with a large reproduction). In all three it was suggested that it might come from a choirbook of the Sainte-Chapelle Paris which owned a relic of the Crown of Thorns which seems to be given exceptional prominence in the composition.


In 1996 it was compared to the De Thou Gradual ('with extremely similar illumination') commissioned in 1536 for the church of Saint-Andre-des-Arts Paris (on the left bank a few minutes' walk from the Sainte-Chapelle).

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: A collection of 15 manuscript and printed text leaves and cuttings 13th-16th century
description:
A collection of 15 medieval text leaves and cuttings and early printed leaves


in Latin on vellum and paper. [England Netherlands Italy France 13th-16th century]


Comprising:


(1) Three small vellum fragments of Peter Lombard's Sentences. [England or France early 13th century] various shapes and sizes c.60x15 - 10x80mm written in very fine early gothic script formerly used as binders' waste with resultant cuts and creases but remarkably clean and legible


(2) Printed leaf from a Gospel commentary. [c. 1500] small folio double column gothic type two historiated woodcut initials two other smaller woodcut initials fol. lxxvii


(3) Printed leaf from a Carmelite missal. [Venice: Giunta 1509] 8vo leaf containing the end of the table and a full-page woodcut of the Annunciation


(4) Printed leaf from a Book of Hours in Dutch. [Paris: Thielman Kerver 12 February 1500/01] 8vo leaf c6 text in red and black within a metalcut border [ISTC ih004328000] cropped at edges


(5) Leaf from a Book of Hours. [France 15th century second half] c.107x80 13 lines in batarde script comprising the end of the gospel extract from Luke and rubric for that of Matthew Provenance: Reported to be from a Hours of the Use of Amiens


(6) Printed leaf from a Bible. [Venice: Giunta 1519] 8vo fol. 507 containing part of the text of Hebrews


(7) Leaf from a Book of Hours. [Southern Netherlands 15th century] c.125x95mm 16 lines in gothic textura the text comprising Matthew 2:2-11 part of the usual gospel extract found in Books of Hours


(8) Calendar leaf from a miniature Book of Hours. [England 15th century] c.95x63mm 17 lines gothic script major feasts (in red) include Hugh (17 Nov.) and King Edmund (20 Nov.) ordinary feasts include Edmund the Confessor (16 Nov.) illuminated KL monogram


(9) Leaf from a Psalter. [Southern Netherlands (Flanders) 13th century 1st half] c.120x80mm 20 lines above top line the text comprising Ps. 75:8-76:12 75:12 omitted and added later in the lower margin; 1- and 3-line illuminated initials


(10) Three fragments of binders' waste from an unidentified scholarly text. [France or Germany? 14th century] c.25x95-290mm 2 columns each strip preserving about 7 lines of heavily abbreviated gothic script formerly used as swing-guards with resultant holes creases etc.


(11) Leaf from an unusual Prayerbook. [France 15th century second half] c.155x105 mm foliated '12' 31 lines in a fine batarde script with calligraphic flourishes 1- and 2-line ILLUMINATED INITIALS alternately gold or blue flourished in blue or red respectively


(12) Two leaves from a Bible [France (Paris) 13th century] each c.160x100mm 2 columns of 43 lines DECORATED WITH PENWORK-FLOURISHED INITIALS in red and blue Provenance: Probably from a Bible in the collections of Lord Saltoun sold at Sotheby's 19 May 1958 lot 75 and William Foyle sold at Christie's 11 July 2000 lot 16


(13) Leaf from a Book of Hours. [Italy 15th century] c.123x88mm 12 lines in a fine gothic script the text comprising part of the Office of the Dead including the start of the 4th lection marked by an initial in blue with red flourishing extending most of the height of the page


(14) Leaf from a Book of Hours. [France 15th century second half] c.82x65mm 16 lines gothic script the text comprising the end of the canticle 'Ego dixi' and the start of Psalm 148 probably from Lauds in the Office of the Dead with 1- and 2-line illuminated initials


(15) Leaf from a Gradual. [Spain 16th/17th century] 9 lines of text and music in square notation on five-lines staves initials in blue and red the text for Christmas day and the following Sunday foliated 'xxii'

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Illuminated leaf from Gerard of Cremona's Latin translation of Abu Bakr al-Razi (Rhasis) [France 14th century]
description:
Abu Bakr al-Razi (Rhasis)


Leaf from Gerard of Cremona's Latin translation of Abu Bakr Muhammad ibn Zakariya Razi (Rhasis) Nonus Almansoris illuminated manuscript on vellum. [France (Montpellier and/or Paris?) early 14th century]


Single leaf c. 375 x 255 mm written in two columns of 48 lines in a somewhat round gothic bookhand in brown and red inks decorated with numerous one-line initials alternately red or blue two- and three-line initials in red or blue with penwork flourishing of the other colour and TWO LARGE ILLUMINATED INITIALS INCORPORATING DRAGONS ETC. WITH EXTENSIONS REACHING AROUND THREE SIDES OF THE TEXT ON WHICH ARE PERCHED ANIMALS HUMANS AND HYBRID CREATURES INCLUDING A WOMAN PLAYING A DULCIMER A MAN SHOOTING AN ARROW AT A BIRD AND A DOG BARKING AT A VIOLIN-PLAYING MONEY with running-title in the upper margin and a 19th-century inscription in the lower margin (see Provenance); one small hole in the inner upper corner and a light stain in the outer upper corner neither affecting the text or decoration slight darkening of the outer edges slight wear to the running-title minor flaking of pigments and gold but overall in very fine condition.


PROVENANCE


1. The somewhat rounded (almost Italianate) script and rather pale brown ink suggest that the manuscript may have been written in southern France perhaps at Montpellier which in the 14th century was the leading centre in Europe for the study of medicine. The high quality of the illumination however suggests that it may have been decorated in Paris.

2. It was demonstrably still in use in the 15th century when its owner numbered the lists of chapters using medieval Arabic numerals (in which for example the shape of '5' looks like a modern '4' and '7' is rotated counter-clockwise.

3. Unidentified 19th-century German owner: with his inscription in which he sends it to a friend and asks for its return in due course apparently signed 'c. Pony'(?).

4. Kalebdjian Freres Paris their no. 537; sold in 1924 to:

5. Robert Lehman (1891-1969) 'who may be counted among the greatest twentieth-century collectors of manuscripts' (Pia Palladino Treasures of a Lost Art 2003 p. 2); his no. A.3 (subsequently renumbered MS 6); bequeathed to his son:

6. Robin Lehman (b. 1936); on deposit at the Metropolitan Museum New York until acquired in 2004 by7. Jorn Gunther; from whom it was acquired by the present owner.


TEXT


The first rubric tells the reader that this is the book of Rhasis called Almansor translated from Arabic into Latin by Master Gerard of Cremona at Toledo: 'Incipit liber Rasis qui dicitur Almasorius a magistro Giraudo Cremonensi apud Toletum ex Arabico in Latinum translatus a libri filii Zaccarie. Incipit liber qui ab eo vocatur Almasorius eo quod regis Almasori filii Ysaac precepto editus est. Prologus. Rubrica prima.' and this is followed by the start of the prologue text: 'In hoc meo libro aggregabo regi cui benedicat deus ...'. Lower down the same column the main text starts with a rubric 'Predicatione tractatum huius libri. Pars prima de figura et forma est membrorum ...'; in the second column there is the start of a list (which continues on the verso) of the chapters of the work. 


This is the start of the Nonus Almansoris i.e. Book IX of the Liber Almansoris (The Book of Medicine dedicated to Mansur) which was often written and circulated as a separate work.


Known as Al-Rhasis (or Rhazes; Man of Ray) after his birthplace Ray near Tehran was a student of philosophy logic metaphysics poetry and music. He is said to have begun his medical studies aged thirty and soon became one of the most famous physicians of his day as well as director of the hospital of Baghdad. Numerous books on medicine chemistry philosophy and alchemy are attributed to his pen.


Of the ten books of the encyclopaedic Liber Almansoris Book IX concerns pathology and it became a standard work on therapeutic medicine; it was translated with commentaries several times and remained popular long after the medieval period studied y such Renaissance physicians as Vesalius.


This was the first leaf of the parent manuscript and doubtless the most lavishly illuminated. It embodies ninth-century Arabic learning translated into Latin in the 'twelfth-century Renaissance' produced for a wealthy bibliophile in fourteenth-century France.


LITERATURE

Seymour de Ricci and W. J. Wilson Census of Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the United States and Canada II (New York: The Bibliographical Society of America 1937; repr. 1961) p. 1704

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Calligraphic manuscript specimen sheet depicting St Jerome in his study [Germany (Nuremberg?) c. 1600]
description:
St Jerome


Large calligraphic manuscript specimen sheet depicting St Jerome in his study manuscript on vellum. [Germany (Nuremberg?) c. 1600]


Single leaf c. 530 x 430 mm a central portrait of St Jerome with his lion sitting at a desk with an open book in front of him and a closed book held in his right hand a mechanical clock to his left with a shelf of books behind him set within an architectural surround cartouches of text within the surround in different calligraphic styles (most of which are passages from the Gospel of Luke the largest one at the head being from Jerome's preface to Luke) the portrait in blue ink the rest in brown ink and highlighted with gold a few creases from earlier folding of the sheet a small hole at the lower left hand side slightly soiled at edges 


A large and magnificent example of calligraphic specimens in an elaborate architectural frame decorated with flowers and leaves intricate volutes and cherub's heads. The calligraphy ranges from tiny cursive German lettering to monumental gothic script in either Latin and German according to the type of script with St Jerome portrayed in his study with writing implements in front of him. The knife on the desk contains the tiny initials WM presumably indicating the artist and/or calligrapher.

The centre for calligraphy in the sixteenth century was Nuremberg the home of Johann Georg Neudorffer the elder whose school continued in the hands of his descendents through the rest of the sixteenth century. 


PROVENANCE


Purchased from Les Enluminures 2011

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Book of hours in Dutch illuminated manuscript on vellum [Netherlands c.1481] contemporary binding
description:
Book of Hours in Dutch


illuminated manuscript on vellum. [Netherlands (South Holland) 15th century (last quarter) with additions datable to c.1481]


155 leaves c.165x110mm with no flyleaves but apparently COMPLETE collation: 112 2-78; 8-138; 14-188 198-1 (final blank cancelled); traces of catchwords survive sporadically; ruled in ink for 19 lines per page the ruled space c.106x67mm; written in a fine gothic script; decorated with ONE FULL-PAGE MINIATURE SURROUNDED BY A FULL BORDER from (or intended for) a much smaller volume with an added full border THREE 8-LINE INITIALS ACCOMPANIED BY A FULL BORDER SIX 5-LINE INITIALS IN GOLD WITH BLUE PENWORK one 4-line initial in blue with red penwork for Lauds 2-line initials throughout alternately blue with red penwork or vice versa 1-line initials alternately plain red or blue (minor blemishes throughout but overall in fine condition). SEWN ON FIVE BANDS AND BOUND IN CONTEMPORARY POLISHED BROWN LEATHER OVER WOOD BOARDS each cover blind-tooled with a lattice pattern the interstices with flower motif and fleurs-de-lys the edges of the leaves gilt (the two clasps missing the upper joint broken).


PROVENANCE


1. Aeltgen daughter or widow of Jan Bochs: the end of the original text is followed by an added ownership inscription: 'Dit boeck hoert toe Aeltgen Jan Bochs. Diet vyndt brenct det weder om die minne gods' (f. 153v); several pages originally left unwritten have added prayers apparently by the same scribe including those immediately after the calendar with the date 1481.

2. Maria Spruijt late 15th/16th century (inscription upper pastedown); she may have been responsible for several additions to the calendar.

3. Mary Willett of 'Cudwells' Lindfield East Sussex (late 19th-century inscription upper pastedown).

4. Hodgson & Co. London Catalogue of Rare & Valuable Books Manuscripts and Bindings 29 March 1906 lot 182.

5. J. & J. Leighton London Catalogue of Manuscripts Mostly Illuminated Many in Fine Bindings (1912) no. 149.

6. Reginald Cecil Powys-Lybbe (1881-1930) of Thurle Grange Streatley Berkshire (inscription upper pastedown).

7.Sotheby's 11 July 1960 lot 159; bought by a friend of the present owner to whom it was given.


TEXT


1. (ff. 1r-11r) Calendar with the seven feasts indicative of the diocese of Utrecht all in red: Pontianus (14 January) Pancratius (12 May) Odulf (12 June) Lebuin (25 June and 12 November) the translation of Martin (4 July); and Willibrord (7 November); St Augustine (28 August) is in plain black.

2. (ff. 11r-12v) Five added prayers 'Dit is die .v. collect op den paesch'; notes relating to Easter dated 1481 (reproduced in the 1912 Leighton catalogue see Provenance); a rubric introducing the Hours 'Hier beghint onser liever vrouwen ghetide in duutsche'; and further prayers.

3. (ff. 13r-60r) Hours of the Virgin with Matins (f. 13r) Lauds (f. 22r) Terce (f. 35r) Sext (f. 38r) None (f. 41v) Vespers (f. 44v) and Compline (f. 51r).

4. (ff. 61r-76v) The Seven Penitential Psalms (with rubric on f. 60r 'Hier beghinnen die seven psalmen van penitencien in duutse') followed (f. 71v) by a litany of saints in which Augustine is first among the confessors; and collects.

5. (ff. 77r-108r) Prayers including ones on the Seven Last Words to the Virgin to one's guardian angel to numerous saints and at Mass.

6. (ff. 109r-153v) Office of the Dead with rubric on f. 108r 'Hier beghint die langhe veghelie in duutsche mit neghen lessen'.

7. (ff. 153v-155v) Added ownership inscription (see Provenance) and prayers.


ILLUMINATION


Each of the major texts is introduced by a large illuminated initial and full border (ff. 13r 61r 109r) and each begins a new quire. The illumination can be attributed to South Holland (Zuid-Holland) i.e. the area between Rotterdam Leiden and Gouda. The main evidence is the presence of St Jeroen on 17 August in red in the calendar: he was venerated in a wide area around Noordwijk on the North Sea coast near Leiden where his relics were found and is almost always entered in red in manuscripts produced in Leiden (see Anne Korteweg 'Books of Hours from the Northern Netherlands Reconsidered: the Uses of Utrecht and Windesheim and Geert Grote's Role as a Translator' in Books of Hours Reconsidered ed. by S. Hindman and J.H. Marrow (London 2013) pp. 233-59 at 238). Secondly the pen-flourishing uses motifs known as 'radishes' and 'aubergines' and is a wide-spread style in South Holland. In the painted decoration the striking yellow bulbs that sprout from circular blue flowers can only be paralleled in manuscripts from South Holland in the last quarter of the century.


The final page of the middle section was originally left blank to which was stuck a single-leaf miniature with a gently arched top surrounded by a full border of acanthus leaves and gold discs (f.108v); the miniature depicts a Funeral Service with a hooded mourner sitting to one side of a bier draped in a blue cloth surrounded by lighted talers and two clerics performing the service. The miniature appears to be Flemish of about the mid-century and thus was probably extracted from an older Book of Hours or it may have existed as a loose sheet.


BIBLIOGRAPHY


Unpublished apart from the auction and dealer catalogues cited under Provenance.


We are grateful to Anne Korteweg and Ed van der Vlist for their generous help with this manuscript.

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Adamantius Physiognomonica Paris Conrad Neobar 1540 later red morocco gilt
description:
Property from the Loverdos Collection


Adamantius


Physiognomonica. Paris: Conrad Neobar 1540


small 8vo (128 x 82mm.) woodcut device on title-page text in Greek late nineteenth-century red morocco gilt gilt edges occasional light foxing small adhesive label to upper cover


FIRST EDITION RARE. Adamantius was a late fourth-century Jewish physician from Alexandria and his work on physiognomy was based on (or perhaps paraphrased) a second-century text by Polemo of Laodicea. The first section deals just with eyes and the second section covers the other parts of the body. There is a printed note on the verso of the title-page stating that the manuscript used was from the library of the bishop of Lavaur Georges de Selve (1508-1541) one of the sitters of Holbein's The Ambassadors who had been ambassador to Venice in the later 1530s where he purchased Greek manuscripts.


The printer Neobar was appointed royal printer in 1539 though he died shortly after in 1540 to be succeeded by Robert Estienne. His device of a snake twisted around a staff is similar to the one later used by Estienne for his Greek printings.


See lot 7 for another edition containing the text of Adamantius and Polemo.


LITERATURE

USTC 147718


PROVENANCE

K.S. Staikos bookplate

item_title: Aelianus Variae historiae [and other works] Rome Blado 1545 modern half vellum
description:
Property from the Loverdos Collection


Aelianus Heraclides Polemo Adamantius and Melampus


Ailianou poikiles istorias. biblia id. Ek ten Erakleidou peri politeion upomnema. Polemonos phisiognomonikon egkheiridion... Variae historiae... Rome: Antonio Blado January 1545


4to (207 x 148mm.) woodcut device on title-page and final verso text in Greek with blank leaf between index and colophon modern half vellum title-page soiled cut slightly close at head


EDITIO PRINCEPS of Claudius Aelianus's miscellaneous collection of maxims and anecdotes containing details of various Greek writers and historians with information about daily habits and customs of the times such as fishing or dress.


Heraclides Lembus wrote a substantial history which survives only in fragments but includes the epitome of the Athenian Constitution which appears here. For the editio princeps of Adamantius on physiognomy based on an earlier text by Polemo (which precedes it in this volume) see lot 6. The work on divination by interpreting twitches (palmomancy) is attributed here to the soothsayer Melampus.

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Aristophanes Comoediae novem Venice Aldus 1498 modern leather
description:
Property from the Loverdos Collection


Aristophanes


Comoediae novem [Greek edited by Marcus Musurus with the scholia]. Venice: Aldus Manutius 15 July 1498


Super-Chancery folio (283 x 198mm.) 344 leaves (of 348) p8 a-g8 d10 e-x8 o10 p-u8 ph6 kh-o8 A-E8 Z6 E-L8 M4 N-O8 P10 R-S8 T6 th4-5 transposed Greek type woodcut initials and headpieces modern leather lacking text leaves D2 and Ks2 and blank leaves k8 and T6 numerous paper repairs (with substantial restoration at beginning and end) cut somewhat close with a few headlines shaved; sold not subject to return


EDITIO PRINCEPS of nine of the surviving comedies of Aristophanes.


The editor Marcus Musurus made use of at least four manuscripts for the text and from which he compiled the scholia. The plays Peace and Ekklesiazousai were added late on in the editorial process after Musurus managed to obtain the manuscript containing the end of the former and the whole of the latter. Aldus states in his preface that he omitted Lysistrata because he could only find half the full text. Two more plays were published in 1515 by the Giunta in Florence though the editor Eufrosino Bonini failed to use the manuscript containing those two plays to improve the remaining text.


LITERATURE

Aldo Manuzio tipografo 26; ISTC ia00958000; Renouard 16/3; UCLA 25

item_title: Aristotle Historia animalium; Theophrastus Venice Aldus 1497 volume 3 only half blue morocco
description:
Property from the Loverdos Collection


Aristotle


Historia animalium [and other works]; Theophrastus. Venice: Aldus Manutius 29 January 1497


volume 3 only (of 5) Super-Chancery folio (290 x 203mm.) 464 leaves (of 467) aaaa-iiii kk llll-zzpsps &&oo AA-PP10 RR10+1 SS PhPh10 KhKh8 P8 Greek text woodcut initials and headpieces a printed slip pasted to the foot of fol.100v supplying a line of missing text annotations in Latin and Greek modern half blue morocco without blank KhKh8 lacking additional leaf at end of quire PP and final text leaf occasional staining (particularly quire ffzz and PP1_10) PP10 slightly discoloured and frayed at edges


A VOLUME FROM THE EDITIO PRINCEPS OF ARISTOTLE containing his works on biology and a few related texts by Theophrastus. The final quire contains the spurious tenth book of Aristotle on animals; the final text leaf (here lacking) contained five lines in Latin apologising for this quire appearing in the incorrect location in the volume rather than any of the text of Aristotle.


The printed slip pasted to fol.100v is recorded in several variants and this one does not match any of those illustrated in Geri della Rocca de Candal "Lost in transition: a significant correction in Aldus Manutius's Psalterion (1496/98)" The Library 7th series 23 (2022) 155-179 p.171 though it is suggested that the correction was produced in perhaps 15 variants all set on one page of type. It has also been suggested that this is the first recorded use of printed correction slips.


An additional leaf printed on one side only was inserted at the end of quire PP to supply some missing text but is not present in this copy. Leaf PP10 has the headline corrected in manuscript.


LITERATURE

iSTC ia00959000 (all 5 volumes); Aldo Manuzio tipografo 22; Renouard 11/2; UCLA 21

auction_name: Books Manuscripts and Music from Medieval to Modern
item_title: Aristotle Mechanica Paris 1599 old vellum
description:
Aristotle


Mechanica graeca emendata latina facta et commentariis illustrata ab Henrico Monantholio. Paris: Jerome Perier 1599


4to (224 x 156mm.) title printed in red and black with woodcut device parallel text in Greek and Latin woodcut initials and headpieces woodcut diagrams (1 full-page) old vellum later green paper spine label (torn) lower hinge broken covers slightly warped


This text the earliest Greek work of mechanics is not considered to be by Aristotle himself and it has been suggested the author is Archytas of Tarentum (Thomas N. Winter "The Mechanical Problems in the Corpus of Aristotle" 2007 introduction). The Greek text first appeared as part of the Aldine Aristotle but by the mid-sixteenth century it was of more interest to scientists (including Tartaglia and later Galileo) than scholars of Greek.


The editor Henri de Monantheuil (1536-1606) was a pupil of Ramus and the author of works on mathematics. "On the whole Monantheuil's is the most complete and erudite of the sixteenth-century commentaries on the Mechanica though not the most original in outlook" (P.L. Rose and S. Drake "The Mechanica in the Renaissance" Studies in the Renaissance 1971 65-104 p.100).


The full-page woodcut depicts the moving of the Vatican obelisk in 1585.


LITERATURE

USTC 146709

folio (289 x 196mm.) with final blank modern calf blind-tooled in period style last few leaves somewhat stained from repaired wormholes modern label to foot of spine


A tall copy with some deckle edges. Facio's preface dedicates his translation to Alfonso of Aragon.


Edit 16 records this work with two title-pages one as here and the other with the wording Arrianus de rebus gestis Alexandri regis... (Edit16 3115). This variant is recorded in only one copy by Edit16 indicating perhaps that this title was incorrectly printed and then quickly amended.
